TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract Options

Docs.summary: Represents application and document options in Microsoft Word. Many of the properties for the object correspond to items in the Options dialog box (Tools menu).

remarks.para: Use the property to return the object.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AddBiDirectionalMarksWhenSavingTextFile { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Word adds bidirectional control characters when saving a document as a text file.

remarks.para: Saving text files with bidirectional control characters preserves right-to-left and left-to-right properties and the order of neutral characters.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AddControlCharacters { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AddControlCharacters : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Word adds bidirectional control characters when cutting and copying text.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AddHebDoubleQuote { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AddHebDoubleQuote : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Word encloses number formats in double quotation marks (").

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AlertIfNotDefault { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AlertIfNotDefault : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean (bool in C#) that is True if users are notified if Word is not the default program for viewing and editing documents. Read-write.

remarks.para: The setting of AlertIfNotDefault corresponds to the setting of Tell me if Microsoft Word isn’t the default program for viewing and editing documents on the General tab of the Word Options dialog box. (Choose Options on the File tab.)

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AllowAccentedUppercase { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AllowAccentedUppercase : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: True if accents are retained when a French language character is changed to uppercase.

remarks.para: This property affects only text that's been marked as standard French. For all other languages, accents are always retained even if the AllowAccentedUppercase property is set to False.
If you change a character back to lowercase after an accent mark has been stripped from it, the accent won't reappear.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AllowClickAndTypeMouse { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AllowClickAndTypeMouse : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: True if Click and Type functionality is enabled.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AllowCombinedAuxiliaryForms { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AllowCombinedAuxiliaryForms : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Word ignores auxiliary verb forms when checking spelling in a Korean language document.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AllowCompoundNounProcessing { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AllowCompoundNounProcessing : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Word ignores compound nouns when checking spelling in a Korean language document.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AllowDragAndDrop { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AllowDragAndDrop : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: True if dragging and dropping can be used to move or copy a selection.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AllowFastSave { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AllowFastSave : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Word saves only changes to a document. When reopening the document, Word uses the saved changes to reconstruct the document.

remarks.para: The AllowFastSave and properties cannot be set to True concurrently.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AllowOpenInDraftView { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AllowOpenInDraftView : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean that represents whether to allow users to open documents in draft view. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property corresponds to the Allow opening a document in draft view check box in the Word Options dialog box.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AllowPixelUnits { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AllowPixelUnits : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: True if Microsoft Word uses pixels as the default unit of measurement for HTML features that support measurements.

Docs.summary: True indicates that Microsoft Word opens documents in Reading Layout view. Corresponds to the Allow starting in Reading Layout check box on the General tab of the Options dialog box.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ContextualSpeller { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.ContextualSpeller : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean that represents whether to use the contextual speller to check spelling based on the context of a word and the words around it. Read/write.

remarks.para: The contextual speller indentifies the structure of words and their location within a sentence to determine if spelling is correct. It can find errors that the standard spelling checker cannot find. For example, a user might type "superb owl" instead of "super bowl". Because both "superb" and "owl" are correctly spelled words, the standard spelling checker would not find an error. Based on the words in context of the sentence and the words around them, the contextual speller determines that the correct words are "super" and "bowl" and makes the change automatically.
This property corresponds to the Use contextual spelling check box in the Proofing tab of the Word Options dialog box.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created.

remarks.para: If the object was created in Microsoft Word, this property returns the hexadecimal number 4D535744, which represents the string "MSWD." This value can also be represented by the constant wdCreatorCode.

The Creator property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool DisableFeaturesbyDefault { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True for Microsoft Word to disable in all documents all features introduced after the version of Word specified in the property. The default value is False.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdDisableFeaturesIntroducedAfter DisableFeaturesIntroducedAfterbyDefault { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdDisableFeaturesIntroducedAfter get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdDisableFeaturesIntroducedAfter value); };

Docs.summary: Disables all features introduced after a specified version for all documents.

remarks.para: The property must be set to True prior to setting the DisableFeaturesIntroducedAfterbyDefault property. Otherwise, the setting will not take effect and will remain at its default setting of Word 97 for Windows.

The DisableFeaturesIntroducedAfterbyDefault property sets a global option for the application and affects all documents. If you want to disable features introduced after a specified version for a document only, use the property.
